div.l: And whan þe horse was lose he begynneth to gone
Touard þe fenne þer͗e þe wilde meris renne
And forth with we hie þorogh þik and then̄nne
Þe myller goeth a gayne and no worde he seid
But doth his note and with þe clerkez he pleid
Til þat þeir͗e corne was wel and faire ygrounde
And whan þe mele is sakked and bounde
Þis Iohn goth forth and findeth his horse awey
And gan to crie halrowhalowharow and well a wey
div.note: Also could be read as "l" written over "r."
div.l: Oure horse is lost Aleyn for goddꝭes bones
Step vp þi fete com of man al at ones
Alas oure wardein hath his palfray lorne
Þis Aleyn̄ forgate both mele and corne
Al was oute of his mynde his husbondrie
What whilk wey is he goon̄ he gan to crie
Þe wife came leping outeward at a renne
She seid Alas he goth to þe fenn̄e
With wild mares as fast as þei may go
Vnthank com on his honde þat bonde hem so
And him þat bet shuld knyt þe reyne
Alas qduod Iohn Aleyn̄ be cristes peyne
Ley down̄ þi swerd and I wol myn̄ also
He is ful swift god wote as is a roo
Bi goddꝭes soule he shal scape vs bothe
Whi nadest þou put þe capill in þe lathe
Il haile be god Aleyn̄ thou art a fonne
Thies seli clerkez haue ful fast Ironne
Towardꝭes þe fenne both Aleyn̄ and Iohn
And whan þe myller sagh þei wer͗e gon̄
Half a busshel of þeir͗e mele he hath take
And bade his wife go knede it in a kake
And seid I troue I clerkez wer͗e a ferde
Yit can a myller make a clerk berde
For all þeir͗e arte yit lete hem gon her͗e wey
Lo wher͗e þey gon̄ ye late þe childeren palpaplay
Þei gete him so lightly be my crowne
Þies seli clerkez ronnen vp and downe
With kepe· kepe· war͗e· war͗e· Iuste war͗e þe rer͗e
Go wightly now and I shal kepe him her͗e
But shortly til it was veri night
þei couth not þough þei did al her͗e might
Þe caple cacche he ron so fast a wey faste
Til in a dyke þey cauȝt him atte laste
